description: Attested since the 1400s, from Middle English curasse, curesse, from Old French cuirace, spelling influenced by modern French cuirasse.

entries.meaning: A piece of defensive armor, covering the body from the neck to the girdle.

verbs.description: cuirass (third-person singular simple present cuirasses, present participle cuirassing, simple past and past participle cuirassed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cover with defensive armor; to armor-plate.
